## **The Scale is Impressive**

The facility operates 24/7 with 500+ employees managing five independent departments across more than 50 production lines. Their multi-purpose production capabilities include:

```{r}
#| echo: false

# PROCOS Facility Overview - Reader-Friendly Infographic
# Install required packages if needed:
# install.packages(c("ggplot2", "gridExtra", "scales"))

library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
library(scales)

# Set a clean theme
theme_set(theme_minimal(base_size = 14))

# Color palette
procos_colors <- c("#61A60E", "#7C563A", "#61A60E", "#99ccff", "#cce5ff")

# 1. Department and Production Lines (Waffle-style visualization)
dept_data <- data.frame(
  category = c("Departments", "Production Lines", "Employees (x100)"),
  count = c(6, 50, 5),
  color = c(procos_colors[1], procos_colors[2], procos_colors[3])
)

p1 <- ggplot(dept_data, aes(x = reorder(category, count), y = count, fill = category)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7, show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_text(aes(label = ifelse(category == "Employees (x100)", "500+", count)), 
            hjust = -0.2, size = 8, fontface = "bold", color = "#333333") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = dept_data$color) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Facility Scale", 
       subtitle = "24/7 Operations",
       x = NULL, y = NULL) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 18, color = "#333333"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 14, color = "#666666"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold", color = "#333333"),
    axis.text.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = margin(20, 20, 20, 20)
  ) +
  ylim(0, max(dept_data$count) * 1.2)

# 2. Production Capacity (Donut chart approach)
capacity_data <- data.frame(
  category = c("Reactor \nCapacity", "Accessory \nEquipment"),
  volume = c(560, 200),
  color = c(procos_colors[1], procos_colors[4])
)

capacity_data$fraction <- capacity_data$volume / sum(capacity_data$volume)
capacity_data$ymax <- cumsum(capacity_data$fraction)
capacity_data$ymin <- c(0, head(capacity_data$ymax, n = -1))
capacity_data$label_position <- (capacity_data$ymax + capacity_data$ymin) / 2
capacity_data$label <- paste0(capacity_data$category, "\n", capacity_data$volume, " mÂ³")

p2 <- ggplot(capacity_data, aes(ymax = ymax, ymin = ymin, xmax = 4, xmin = 3, fill = category)) +
  geom_rect(show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_text(x = 4.5, aes(y = label_position, label = label), 
            size = 5, fontface = "bold", color = "#333333") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = capacity_data$color) +
  coord_polar(theta = "y") +
  xlim(c(2, 4.5)) +
  labs(title = "Production Capacity",
       subtitle = "Total: 760 mÂ³") +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 18, color = "#333333", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 14, color = "#666666", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.margin = margin(20, 20, 20, 20)
  )

# 3. Annual Output (Single large metric)
output_plot <- ggplot() +
  annotate("text", x = 0.5, y = 0.7, 
           label = "2,500+", 
           size = 24, fontface = "bold", color = procos_colors[1]) +
  annotate("text", x = 0.5, y = 0.5, 
           label = "tonnes/year", 
           size = 10, color = "#666666") +
  annotate("text", x = 0.5, y = 0.35, 
           label = "APIs & Pharmaceutical\nIntermediates", 
           size = 6, color = "#999999", lineheight = 0.9) +
  labs(title = "Annual Output") +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 18, color = "#333333", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.margin = margin(20, 20, 20, 20)
  ) +
  xlim(0, 1) + ylim(0, 1)

# Combine all plots with better spacing

#                        vjust = 1)

p1

```

## **Technology That Stands Out**

Walking through their production areas, I was particularly impressed by their Flow Chemistry Technology and High Pressure Hydrogenators (capable of reaching 60 bar). Real-time monitoring systems track hundreds of process parameters continuously across all lines.

## **Global Reach, Italian Roots**

Acquired by a Japanese company in 2006, PROCOS maintains its headquarters and R&D center here in Italy while operating sales offices across five continents.\

```{r}
#| echo: false

# PROCOS Global Office Connection Map
# Install required packages if needed:
# install.packages(c("maps", "geosphere"))

library(geosphere)
library(maps)
library(ggrepel)

# Define office locations
locations <- data.frame(
  city = c("Italy", "New York", "Germany", "Slovakia", "India", "Tokyo"),
  lon = c(8.6218, -74.0060, 10.4515, 19.6990, 78.9629, 139.6917),
  lat = c(45.4469, 40.7128, 51.1657, 48.6690, 20.5937, 35.6762),
  type = c("HQ/R&D/Factory", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales", "Sales"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Create connection routes from HQ (Italy) to all sales offices
hq_idx <- which(locations$city == "Italy")
sales_idx <- which(locations$type == "Sales")

# Generate great circle routes
all_routes <- data.frame()

for(i in sales_idx) {
  route <- gcIntermediate(
    c(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx]),
    c(locations$lon[i], locations$lat[i]),
    n = 100,
    addStartEnd = TRUE,
    sp = FALSE
  )
  route <- as.data.frame(route)
  route$group <- paste(locations$city[hq_idx], locations$city[i], sep = "-")
  all_routes <- rbind(all_routes, route)
}

# Create the map
par(mar = c(0, 0, 2, 0), bg = "#f0f0f0")

# Plot base world map
maps::map(database = "world", col = "#e8e8e8", fill = TRUE, border = "#cccccc", 
    ylim = c(10, 70), xlim = c(-100, 150))

# Add connection lines
for(group in unique(all_routes$group)) {
  route_data <- all_routes[all_routes$group == group, ]
  lines(route_data$lon, route_data$lat, 
        col = "#7AB8D7", lwd = 1.5, lty = 1)
}

# Add office points
points(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx], 
       pch = 21, cex = 3, col = "#61A60E", bg = "#61A60E", lwd = 2)
points(locations$lon[sales_idx], locations$lat[sales_idx], 
       pch = 21, cex = 2, col = "#7C563A", bg = "#7C563A", lwd = 2)

# Add labels
text(locations$lon[hq_idx], locations$lat[hq_idx], 
     labels = "Italy\n(HQ/R&D/Factory)", 
     pos = 1, cex = 0.75, font = 2, col = "#61A60E")

for(i in sales_idx) {
  text(locations$lon[i], locations$lat[i], 
       labels = paste0(locations$city[i], "\n(Sales)"), 
       pos = 3, cex = 0.7, col = "#7C563A")
}

# Add title
title(main = "PROCOS Global Office Network", 
      cex.main = 1.5, font.main = 2, col.main = "#333333")

# Add legend
legend("bottomleft", 
       legend = c("HQ/R&D/Factory", "Sales Office", "Connection"), 
       pch = c(21, 21, NA), 
       lty = c(NA, NA, 1),
       col = c("#61A60E", "#7C563A", "#7AB8D7"),
       pt.bg = c("#61A60E", "#7C563A", NA),
       pt.cex = c(2, 1.5, NA),
       lwd = c(2, 2, 1.5),
       bty = "n",
       cex = 0.8)
```
